jot.io.device.handlers

Class Mouse

  • java.lang.Object
    • jot.io.device.handlers.Mouse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jogamp.newt.event.MouseListener, com.jogamp.newt.event.NEWTEventListener, EventListener, Input, TrackableInput

    public class Mouse
extends Object
implements TrackableInput, com.jogamp.newt.event.MouseListener
    Class that implements a mouse input handler.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Mouse()
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getAcceleration()
      Get the acceleration in of a generic device cursor, e.g., for a Wiimote its roll, pitch, and yaw, etc.
      org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getPosition()
      Get the position in 3D Cartesian space of a generic device cursor, e.g., for a Wiimote its a X, Y, Z coordinate, for a mouse its the mouse cursor X and Y values, etc.
      org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getPositionShift()
      Get the difference between a generic device cursor current and old position.
      boolean isContinuouslyDetecting(String inputEvent)
      Test if for a generic input device and specific provided event is occurring, e.g., mouse button or keyboard key is pressed.
      boolean isDetecting(String inputEvent)
      Test if for a generic input device and specific provided event is occurring, e.g., mouse button or keyboard key is typed/clicked.
      void mouseClicked(com.jogamp.newt.event.MouseEvent e)

      void mouseWheelMoved(com.jogamp.newt.event.MouseEvent e) 
      void registerInputEvent(String inputEvent, int inputDeviceEvent)
      Register a specific inputEvent to be associated with a generic input device event, e.g., associate "shoot" with a key pressed.

                               int inputDeviceEvent)

      • isDetecting

        public boolean isDetecting(String inputEvent)
        Description copied from interface: Input
        Test if for a generic input device and specific provided event is occurring, e.g., mouse button or keyboard key is typed/clicked.
        Specified by:
        isDetecting in interface Input
        Parameters:
        inputEvent - specific provided generic input event, e.g., mouse button clicked, keyboard key typed, 3D camera detected movement, etc.
        Returns:
        TRUE if provided input event is occurring, otherwise returns FALSE.
